result.execSummary:
The defendant Megan L. Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Special disposition under 973.015 if paid in full on/before April 11, 2016.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Megan L. Scott

No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant (TR)

3:51 p.m. Defendant Megan L. Scott in court. Michael Schiek appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant would like extension so that expungement stays. Court authorizes community service until defendant is employed. Community service is only for this case. Expungement to continue - To be paid in full or community service by next court date. Adj. 3:54 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for August 29, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

11:18 am. Defendant Megan L. Scott in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.  Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Michlig/Voorhees/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing. Court imposes fine of $579.00 including costs. Special disposition under Section 973.015 if all fines/costs paid in full by April 11, 2016.  Review hearing scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Voluntary appearance at 09-18-2015 11:00 am

1:54 p.m. Attorney John E Voorhees in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not in court - Voorhees does not know why defendant is not in court - will try to contact. Court authorizes warrant. Adj. 2:01 p.m.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

02:54 pm - Defendant Megan L. Scott in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
May not be on any Walmart premises

02:54 pm - Defendant Megan L. Scott in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Also calling 15fo462 -  Court addresses no payments since April - Has been unemployed for a couple of months - plans on bringing in a payment next week.  Court grants extension.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
